src:
"La familia de Macri se hizo robando"
06 Nov 2019 by Redacción Diario de Cuyo
El secretario general de la Unión Ferroviaria, Rubén "Pollo" Sobrero, cuestionó al presidente Mauricio Macri y también al mandatario electo Alberto Fernández, al afirmar que "ya" lo desilusionó.
"La familia Macri se hizo así, robando. Los que lo rodean a él siempre ganaron, ganaron con la deuda, siempre con la timba financiera. Nunca pasaron hambre. ¿Qué va a saber Macri de que un pibe no puede comer? ¿O este muchacho, Marquitos Peña, qué puede saber? No entienden nada de eso", agregó el dirigente gremial en declaraciones televisivas.
Asimismo, indicó que "ellos son coherentes con su clase, gobernaron para ellos, aplicaron la política del derrame que nunca llega, y la política de la meritocracia que en una país con esta desigualdad es imposible discutir".
En tanto, al ser consultado sobre Alberto Fernández, respondió que "ya" está "desilusionado" y cuestionó el hecho de que "en el gabinete que está formando son todos menemistas". No obstante, afirmó que "sería necio decir "son todos malos", porque tampoco los vi gobernar todavía".
"Dentro de este régimen capitalista hay poco margen para sacar a toda nuestra población que está en la extrema pobreza. Quizás puedas tener más consumo, o no tenga las tarifas dolarizadas, pero el tema es estructural. En un país como Argentina no podemos padecer nada, tenemos de todo", aseveró.
"La transición la están aprovechando para meternos todo el ajuste que tienen que hacer", dijo en otro tramo de la entrevista y, al profundizar sus críticas contra Fernández, agregó: "No puede ser que todos los días haya aumentos y Alberto no diga: "che, paren un poco la moto"". "Alberto pertenecía al círculo rojo, votó en blanco como nosotros. Sin embargo a nosotros nos matan y a él lo llevaron de candidato a presidente", indicó.
text:
"Macri's family was robbed"
06 Nov 2019 by Cuyo Daily Writing
The general secretary of the Railway Union, Rubén "Pollo" Sobrero, questioned President Mauricio Macri and also the elected president Alberto Fernández, stating that he "already" disappointed him.
"The Macri family did so, stealing. Those around him always won, won with the debt, always with the financial timba. They never went hungry. What will Macri know that a kid can't eat? Or this boy, Marquitos Peña, what can he know? They don't understand any of that, "the union leader said in television statements.
He also indicated that "they are consistent with their class, governed for them, applied the policy of the spill that never comes, and the politics of meritocracy that in a country with this inequality is impossible to discuss."
Meanwhile, when asked about Alberto Fernández, he replied that "he" is already "disappointed" and questioned the fact that "they are all menemists in the cabinet he is forming." However, he said that "it would be foolish to say" they are all bad ", because I have not seen them rule yet."
"Within this capitalist regime there is little room to get our entire population out of extreme poverty. Perhaps you can have more consumption, or do not have dollarized rates, but the issue is structural. In a country like Argentina we cannot suffer anything , we have everything, "he said.
"The transition is being used to put all the adjustment they have to make," he said in another section of the interview and, deepening his criticism against Fernandez, he added: "It cannot be that there are increases every day and Alberto does not say: "Che, stop the motorcycle a little" ". "Alberto belonged to the red circle, he voted blank like us. However, they kill us and he was taken from candidate to president," he said.
